pages.text: $(o)Here are a few noteworthy features to keep in mind.

$(item)Litmus Paper$(0) is a Specially-Treated Sheet of Paper that can be used to Measure the Strength of Powers in the Crucible. $(p)$(o)Use it on a Crucible to take the measurement, and use it elsewhere to read it.

$(o)$(item)Litmus Paper$(0) also shows whether the Powers in the Crucible are causing reactions, and if not, why not. The messages are relatively self-explanatory, but keep in mind that they only refer to $(4)reactions possible with the current combination of Powers$(0).

$(thing)Transmutations$(0) (transforming an item into another) can only be Performed if a Certain Threshold of Total Power has been reached. Specifically, a Transmutation may occur if all Reagents are present and at least One crosses the unseen Threshold.

$(o)The $(#AF5220)Body Power$(0) inhibits reactions from taking place. If you need an unfortunate combination of Powers for something, add some Body. $(p)Litmus Paper will present the status '$()(Reaction Name) Inhibited$(o)' if something, including Body Power, is preventing a reaction.
$(o)I found this recipe in an book from long ago. Something about a movable Crucible? $(br2)Might be worth trying if you can figure out what that purple thing is supposed to be.
In Making the $(item)Staff of Power$(0), the Order follows that of the Reactions of the Secret Powers under a Golden Sign. $(p)$(4)$(bold)BLASTING$(br)FOAMING$(br)GRID BREAK$(p)$()This is the Order.
